description: Using npm's package.json file purely for simple organization of many shell commands, each can be easily invoked as `npm run <script>` if node.js/npm is installed.

scripts.pkg:check-build-data: npm run pkg:clean && npm run pkg:build && npm run pkg:extract && npm run pkg:diff-build-data
scripts.dev:init: python3 -m venv venv && source venv/Scripts/activate && pip install --upgrade pip && pip install -e . && pip install -e .[dev]
scripts.tox:test: tox run -e py39-test && tox run -e combine-test-reports
scripts.tox:all_FULL: tox run -e lint && tox run -e types && tox run -e test && tox run -e combine-test-reports && tox run -e docs  && tox run -e build
scripts.tox:all: tox run -e lint && tox run -e test && tox run -e combine-test-reports && tox run -e docs  && tox run -e build
scripts.docs: npm run tox:docs && npm run docs:test && npm run docs:auto-api
scripts.all_FULL: npm run format && npm run lint && npm run types && npm run test && npm run docs && npm run build
scripts.all: npm run format && npm run lint && npm run test && npm run docs && npm run build
